name: Al-Arqam Islamic School
mission: TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE MUSLIM CHILDREN LIVING WITHIN THE GREATER SACRAMENTO AREA.
theoryOfChange: Al-Arqam Islamic School has a published program strategy outlined in its 'Islamic Education' section, which details 'Al-Arqam Student Learning Goals'. These goals serve as a strategic framework, describing the desired outcomes for students, such as living Islam, becoming lifelong learners, effective communicators, citizens of the world, and honoring themselves physically and spiritually. The curriculum from Pre-K to 12th grade is designed to embody these learning goals.

alignment.rationale: Alignment 24/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School earns 50/100 due to moderate impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The 'Donations' page of Al-Arqam Islamic School lists methods for general donations (checks, PayPal, Zelle) but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or dedicated zakat funds.

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a program expense ratio of 98.1% and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
Al-Arqam Islamic School reported total revenue of $4,155,519 and holds 9.1 months of working capital.
The school offers the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program and college preparatory academics.
The organization operates as Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory.
The school implements a student honor code and parent policy handbook to maintain its educational environment.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The school demonstrates excellent financial health and efficiency in its operations, though its overall score is moderated by low data confidence and a specific regional focus.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public data regarding specific long-term impact metrics and beneficiary outcomes
Lower alignment for general Muslim donors due to the localized nature of the mission

dimension_explanations.alignment: The school serves a critical need for Islamic education in Sacramento, but the donor fit is considered low for a global audience due to its localized scope [3][5]. The mission is centered on sadaqah-eligible educational support rather than urgent global humanitarian relief [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through its IB Diploma Program and college preparatory academics [1][3]. While it maintains a high program expense ratio of 98.1% and 9.1 months of working capital, the lack of third-party impact verification results in a medium impact score [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Al-Arqam Islamic School provides rigorous college preparatory and International Baccalaureate education to Muslim youth in the Greater Sacramento area.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.1%, indicating nearly all funds go directly to educational services
High fundraising efficiency with $0.00 spent to raise every $1
Strong liquidity with 9.1 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School is a dedicated educational institution focused on meeting the academic and spiritual needs of Muslim children through a comprehensive college preparatory curriculum [2][3]. The school is an authorized provider of the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program, integrating high academic standards with Islamic values [3][5].

case_against.mitigation_notes: The school's long history since 1998 and WASC accreditation provide a baseline of institutional stability.
risk_factors: <cite id="14">No public data on long-term student outcomes</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="15">low data confidence score</cite> and the lack of external impact evaluations.

confidence.notes: While financial efficiency is high, the low data confidence score reflects a lack of public transparency documents.

alignment.explanation: The school offers a <cite id="5">strong Islamic identity</cite> for donors interested in education, though it is <cite id="17">SADAQAH-ELIGIBLE only</cite> and serves a specific geographic niche.

credibility.explanation: Donors can verify the school's standing through its <cite id="12">WASC accreditation</cite> and <cite id="7">100% independent board</cite>, though overall data confidence is <cite id="15">low at 0.30</cite> due to limited public transparency filings.
credibility.improvement: The school could improve credibility by <cite id="14">publishing an annual impact report</cite> that includes student outcomes and audited financial summaries.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite> and a <cite id="16">clear theory of change</cite> centered on capacity building through education.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="14">tracking and reporting beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a clear cost-per-student analysis.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Accredited but limited outcome data

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provider; does not primarily make grants.

rich_narrative.headline: Al-Arqam Islamic School provides rigorous college preparatory and International Baccalaureate education to Muslim youth in the Greater Sacramento area.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value Islamic institutional development and want to invest in high-standard K-12 education within the American Muslim community.
donor_motivations: Want to support the integration of Islamic values with IB-level academics
Value high financial efficiency where 100% of funds reach the school
Prefer supporting established local institutions with a long track record
giving_considerations: Gifts support a localized community in Sacramento
Limited data is available on post-graduation success metrics
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those requiring rigorous RCT-level evidence of impact.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while the school is <cite id="12">accredited by WASC</cite>, it does not publicly share standardized outcome data or external evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The school creates impact by providing a dual-curriculum environment that prepares students for higher education while reinforcing Islamic identity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence of college placement and student retention would help donors understand the long-term ROI of their sadaqah.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="18">$4.2M revenue base</cite> and a localized mission, the school has significant room to expand its facilities and scholarship programs.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="4">98.1% program expense ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="11">peer median of 78.4%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focus on religious services and education
similar_organizations.name: Al Jazari Institute

strengths.detail: The school directs <cite id="4">100.0% of its expenses to programs</cite>, far exceeding the <cite id="11">peer program ratio median of 78.4%</cite>.
Al-Arqam received a <cite id="12">six-year accreditation term</cite> from the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC), valid through 2025.
The organization maintains <cite id="10">9.1 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant safety net for educational operations.

strengths_deep_dive: Al-Arqam's primary strength lies in its specialized curriculum that blends secular and religious excellence. It is an <cite id="6">authorized provider of the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program</cite>, a distinction that requires rigorous external validation. Financially, the school demonstrates remarkable lean management, spending <cite id="13">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in donations, which ensures that community sadaqah is utilized entirely for student services rather than administrative overhead.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1998</cite>, Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory serves the Greater Sacramento area by providing a <cite id="2">rigorous college preparatory and International Baccalaureate (IB) education</cite> to Muslim youth. The institution operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, reporting <cite id="3">$4,155,519 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, with a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 98.1%</cite>. This indicates that nearly all funds are directed toward its core educational mission, which includes <cite id="5">Advanced Placement (AP) courses, honors courses, and Tarbiyyah</cite> (Islamic Studies and Qur’an). As an <cite id="6">authorized IB World School</cite>, Al-Arqam integrates high academic standards with spiritual development, maintaining a <cite id="7">100% independent board of directors</cite> to oversee its operations. While the school relies heavily on <cite id="8">program service revenue of $3,925,159</cite>, it also receives community support through <cite id="9">contributions totaling $224,548</cite>. The organization maintains strong liquidity, holding <cite id="10">9.1 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, ensuring stability for its faculty and students.
